benchmark_details.name: Event-Based Modality Detection
benchmark_details.overview: This paper defines an event-based modality detection task that aims to detect and classify fine-grained modal concepts associated with events in natural language. The task includes modal triggers from any syntactic class and uses a unified taxonomy for modal senses.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance the detection and classification of modal expressions in language processing, improving understanding of modality's role in NLP tasks.

data.source: The GME corpus, obtained by expert annotations of the MPQA Opinion Corpus.
data.annotation: Expert annotation based on a unified taxonomy for modal senses.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated using the official CoNLL evaluation script.
methodology.interpretation: A higher F1 score indicates better model performance in detecting modal senses.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline model results show high precision for identifying modal triggers with various evaluations across granular levels.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation with multiple folds was used for training and testing the models.
